description.narrative: Develop the National Adaptation Plan (NAP) of Armenia to support the Government of Armenia to advance its medium and long-term adaptation planning.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Existence of a validated mandate for climate change adaptation; number of workshops, trainings with stakeholders. 2. Number of training modules developed and number of training sessions conducted with key stakeholders. 3. Number of newly developed guidelines, tools and methodologies; number of sectoral adaptation plans developed. 4. Existence of monitoring and evaluation and cross-sector reporting systems for NAP process. 5. Existence of strategy for private investments in climate change adaptation; number of public private partnership trainings held. 6. Number of monitoring and evaluation reports; donor and UNDP reports.

comment.narrative: 1.No approved national adaptation strategy and implementation plan (2018). 2.Major climate change adaptation capacity gaps exist across sectors (2018). 3.Adaptation not included in national and sectoral development plans (2018). 4.No Monitoring and Evaluation system for climate change adaptation(2018). 5.Financial needs for climate change adaptation not identified(2018). 6.Project implementation, monitoring and evaluation started in 2019.

1.Developed draft proposal on NAP coordination mechanism in the scope of Inter-Agency Coordination Council. 2. Conduct at least three trainings on NAP process and climate change adaptation. 3. Assessment of legal, institutional, vulnerability assessment and adaptation gaps and barriers for at least 4 sectors is conducted. 4. Monitoring and evaluation activities and processes identified and assessed. 5. Not applicable for 2020. 6. Regular monitoring is ensured.

1. Draft PM decree on updated mandate, function and rules of procedures of Inter-Agency Coordination Council developed and submitted to the Ministry of Environment. Framework NAP developed and submitted to Ministry of Environment. 2. 3 trainings (Hydromet specialists; agriculture and water sector representatives; mass media representatives), 3 awareness raising events (webinar for mass media; tree planting; online quizzes) conducted, awareness raising animation video developed. 3. Stocktaking assessments for water and agricultural sectors are conducted and discussed at the webinars (04.06.20 and 13.08.20 respectively). Climate risk and vulnerability assessments for water, energy, tourism and agriculture initiated. 4. Team leader for monitoring and evaluation activities hired. ToRs to identify monitoring and evaluation activities for entry points for adaptation drafted. 5. Not applicable for 2020. 6. The Project board meeting conducted, project webpage regularly updated, regularly reporting to UNDP and GCF ensured. The Project risks were reassessed.

1.Framework NAP document with action plan finalized and approved by the Government. PM decree on updated mandate, function and rules of procedures of Inter-Agency Coordination Council approved by the Government. 2.Conduct at least ten trainings on NAP process and climate change vulnerability assessment and adaptation. 3.Vulnerability assessments and development of adaptation plans for at least 4 sectors conducted. 4.Entry points for climate change adaptation into Monitoring and evaluation system drafted. 5.Current adaptation related public expenditures reviewed. 6.Regular monitoring is ensured.

1.Framework NAP document with action plan developed and approved by the Government (13.05.21). PM decree on updated mandate, function and rules of procedures of Inter-Agency Coordination Council approved by the Government (06.07.21). 2.Fifteen trainings (Hydromet and ArmForest Service specialists, specialists of agriculture extension services, landslide prone community heads of Tavush Region, media representatives and students, school teachers), two awareness raising events (Expo-forum, contest for schoolchildren) conducted. 3.Vulnerability assessments for Water sector finalized; for agriculture, energy, tourism and two marzes (Tavush and Shirak) drafted. Water sector adaptation plan developed. Adaptation plan for agriculture, energy, tourism and two marzes (Tavush and Shirak) launched. 4.ToRs to identify monitoring and evaluation activities for entry points for adaptation finalized. 5.Identification of the medium term budget needs initiated. 6.The Project board meeting conducted, project webpage regularly updated, regularly reporting to UNDP and GCF ensured. The Project risks were reassessed. Budget revised in Q3.

1.Mission and mandate of Inter-Agency Coordination Council on adaptation related activities, roles and responsibilities of stakeholders defined. 2.Training module on vulnerability assessment and adaptation planning drafted. 3.Gender sensitive methodologies to enhance national capacity for adaptation planning drafted. 4. Not applicable for 2019. 5. Not applicable for 2019. 6. Regular monitoring is ensured.

1.Mission and mandate of Inter-Agency Coordination Council on adaptation related activities drafted, presented to the Ministry of Environment, follow-up workshops organized on September 26 and December 11, 2019. 2.Workshop to support representatives and experts of the Ministry of Environment in defining the structure, framework and legal status of National Adaptation Plan documents conducted. Training module on health sector impact from climate change developed, awareness raising seminar conducted on December 05, 2019. Workshop to present energy sector vulnerability under climate change organized on December 10, 2019. 3.Expert hired, Project gender action plan developed, workshop on gender inclusiveness in climate change area conducted on July 18-19, 2019. International consultant hired, structure of the NAP concept note developed. Climate change risk management as a basis for national adaptation workshop organized on December 4, 2019, Tavush region. Climate change awareness raising workshop organized on November 19, 2019, Lori region. 4. Not applicable for 2019. 5. Not applicable for 2019. 6. Inception workshop conducted, project webpage regularly updated, regularly reporting to UNDP and GCF ensured. Project Team Leader participated in the EU4Climate Regional Workshop on adaptation Planning and Mainstreaming of Climate Risks into National and Sectoral Planning Processes, 30 October – 01 November, 2019, Chisinau, Moldova.

1.Parliament and other Ministries sensitized on NAP process and climate change adaptation through three training sessions. 2.Conduct at least ten trainings on NAP process and climate change vulnerability assessment and adaptation. 3.Vulnerability assessments and development of adaptation plans conducted for Health sector and at the Municipality level. 4.Gender sensitive Monitoring and evaluation system for the climate change adaptation and NAP process established. 5.Strategy for private investments in climate change adaptation developed; at least three public private partnership trainings held. 6.Regular monitoring is ensured. Terminal evaluation is conducted.

1.Not applicable for Q1. 2.Two trainings (media students and schoolchildren) conducted. 3.Development of adaptation plans launched for Health sector and at the Municipality level. 4.Gender responsive climate change adaptation indicator and criteria for review and monitoring developed for Water sector and at Marz level. 5.Development of strategy for private investments in climate change adaptation initiated. 6.The Project board meeting conducted, project webpage regularly updated, regularly reporting to UNDP and GCF ensured. The Project risks were reassessed.
